item.title: I need some photos
item.author: invalid@example.com (PETER M)
item.dc:creator: PETER M
item.content:encoded:
Hey folks,

I’m making some collages for TCUP’s socials and I need some photos of bands loading in, soundchecking, running merch, hanging in the green room, etc. Basically, anything from the day of a show that shows the non-music making labor parts of the job.

Do you have any and are you willing to share them? If so, drop ‘em in this thread and lmk the handle you’d like tagged.

Thanks!

P

item.title: Memory Lanes 4/25 - Looking for punk bands!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Aang)
item.category: Find bands to play your show/bill!
item.dc:creator: Aang
item.content:encoded:
Hey y’all!

I’m working on putting together a 4-band bill at Memory Lanes (on the lanes!) for Friday, April 25th, and we’re looking to fill at least two more slots. If you’ve got a punk band and are interested in playing, I’d love to get some TCUP folks on this!

Exact details are still getting confirmed, but the plan right now is:
Showtime: 8 PM - 12 AM
Set Length: 30-45 minute sets
Payment: 80/20 door split in favor of performers

Please reach out if yr interested or have any questions!
-...

Read more

item.title: Day Block Brewing - PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK
item.author: invalid@example.com (Dante)
item.dc:creator: Dante
item.content:encoded:
Hey Folks!

Over the last couple months we've collected feedback about different venues around town with our Venue Report Card Survey - and we have noticed some shady practices at Day Block Brewery that I'll detail below. Have you played a show there recently? What was your experience?

-We have consistently heard from TCUP members and VRC respondents that the venue is inconsistent when it comes to ticketing at shows. If someone is running the door, they might cut the door halfway...

Read more

item.title: Caydence expecting "Pay to Play" for a Benefit Show for Aid--Negative Experience with booking
item.author: invalid@example.com (Oceanographer)
item.dc:creator: Oceanographer
item.content:encoded:
Hey all!

I was very disappointed that a booker with Caydence expected us to "pay to play" for a show that is intended to raise aid for community members. The message I received felt extremely disrespectful and made me feel humiliated when all of us are trying to organize and do a good thing.

Back story, we recently got in touch with Caydence to host a benefit show with a bill full of young folks ages 17-24. The show was initially going to be for LA fire relief aid as we started planning...

Read more

item.title: Labels????
item.author: invalid@example.com (ross.clowser)
item.dc:creator: ross.clowser
item.content:encoded:
Hi All,

I just recorded a full length album and I am trying to figure out where to release it! It's based in jazz and improv, but it falls more in line with the modern, post-rock, sometimes experimental category - think Jeff Parker, Tortoise, a little bit Bad Plus, Alice Coltrane. I am looking at local labels: Shifting Paradigm, Aura Vortex, Innova, and wanted to see what folks' experience has been. What has releasing with a label done for you? Have you had to put up money for promotion...

Read more

item.title: Anyone worked with Damon Contreras?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Sadiebgz)
item.dc:creator: Sadiebgz
item.content:encoded: I was approached by a guy named Damon Contreras at a show who said he’s a broker for cover gigs. I’m curious to hear if anyone has worked with him/what your experience has been.

item.title: Advice for working in music
item.author: invalid@example.com (nathanielm410)
item.dc:creator: nathanielm410
item.content:encoded:
I previously posted this in tcuboard2.0 but this site seems much more active so I thought I would move it here
Hey,

My name is Nathaniel I have been in the Twin Cities music scene for about a year now. I have loved being on stage as a drummer and am looking for another band to join, but I also have found a love for working behind the scenes for bands. I am young, but I have a good background in live sound, photography, and sales, which I think would all be beneficial in different ways...

Read more

item.title: Advance Horror Stories (boo)
item.author: invalid@example.com (beetroot)
item.dc:creator: beetroot
item.content:encoded:
hi all!

i'm collecting “advance horror stories” (i.e., tales of past gigs where lack of a clear show advance/contract caused issues for you and/or your band), as well as positive thoughts/experiences surrounding show advances, for the next issue of the TCUP newsletter!

if you've got a story you'd like to share (and are willing to have it publicized), please drop it in this thread. feel free to leave out any identifying details if you are worried about repercussions.

thank you kindly

item.title: Music Marketing/Ads
item.author: invalid@example.com (mrvron)
item.dc:creator: mrvron
item.content:encoded:
Hello Mr Vron here
I will help you plan your music marketing, video promotion, and help run ads study your data help define audience, at an affordable rate and budget.
Contact: Release@mrvron.com

item.title: Terminal Bar booking information / Little Elephant custom vinyl experiences
item.author: invalid@example.com (thedelviles)
item.dc:creator: thedelviles
item.content:encoded:
If this is the wrong area to post this information, please make me aware.

Here's the booking info for the Terminal:

Booker's name (last I was aware): Javier
Email: terminalbar32@gmail.com
From what I understand, they only have bands Friday and Saturday nights
No clear information on how much of a cut the bar takes, payout in cash
They book a ways out and I have heard they can sometimes double book although this hasn't happened to me. Book with plenty of time and check in before the...

item.title: last minute sound gig opportunity: March 14
item.author: invalid@example.com (laura.kiernan)
item.dc:creator: laura.kiernan
item.content:encoded: hi! my friend reached out about a gig in need of a sound person! pay is about 10% of doors so ~$200 according to them. see attached flyer for more info! if you're available/interested i can connect you with them!

item.title: SEEKING ADVICE: TAXES
item.author: invalid@example.com (laura.kiernan)
item.dc:creator: laura.kiernan
item.content:encoded:
hi everyone its tax season & i am overwhelmed. for the amount that my band made last year i need to issue 1099s to all my bandmates + file as a small business (schedule c). i know i'm past the deadline on issuing 1099s (didn't know there was a deadline until past the deadline lol). i'm thinking of either making an EIN number or LLC for next year. anyways, i think the cost of hiring an accountant is worth it over the hours of tears i have spent so far trying to figure this out on my own. does...

Read more

item.title: Anyone looking to fill a bill?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Trystinney)
item.dc:creator: Trystinney
item.content:encoded: Hey! My band Disposable Days finally got a drummer, and I’m eager to get a show set up with our new lineup. If anyone is looking to fill a bill let me know!

item.title: New heavy noise project looking for a bassist!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Andy Webber)
item.dc:creator: Andy Webber
item.content:encoded:
Hi all,

I'm playing drums in a new project with my friend Cassidy on guitar. We've got a few songs mostly roughed out and we are seeking a bassist. I always struggle to describe genres. He called it New Wave Death Blues, which isn't entirely accurate, but I don't have a better idea. He's into extreme metal and angular dissonant things, as well as Primus and other 90's stuff, and he is a very talented player. I like to hang out in the pocket and just play rock'n'roll, but my writing...

Read more

item.title: Cupboard 2.0 -- "soft-launch" is live now!!
item.author: invalid@example.com (alexschaaf)
item.dc:creator: alexschaaf
item.content:encoded:
edit: Cupboard 2.0 is live! go to portal.tcupboard.org to sign up (you'll have to make a new account there, but its VERY QUICK i promise )

It's in 'beta' phase, which is a dumb phrase but basically there are probably still lots of little kinks to iron out, but it'll be easier to find them once more people start using it, so have at it! I'm leaving this all up for a good while, so you can always reply to this thread with any problems.

item.title: Are venues taking a long time to reply to your booking inquires or not at all?
item.author: invalid@example.com (roryt)
item.dc:creator: roryt
item.content:encoded:
Is it taking weeks or longer to hear back from venues when you send them a booking inquiry? Are some just not responding at all? I've been booking the bands I play in since 2008 but it seems like over the last two to three years venues have gotten really lax on responding. Back before Covid, I would hear back within 24 to 72 hours now weeks will go by and nothing. Sending another follow up message doesn't seem to help. I realize that the number of bands and solo artists around the metro area...

Read more

item.title: Community Networking Event - Let's Talk!
item.author: invalid@example.com (SYM1 // SYMONE)
item.dc:creator: SYM1 // SYMONE
item.content:encoded:
A Twin Cities music industry gathering. Join us for an evening of conversation, connection, and camaraderie.
Introduce yourself to fellow music industry professionals in a relaxed, open-format dialogue.
Drink tickets provided for the first 30 attendees!

Event page here!
